  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundedInput<java.lang.Double>, HTML5Input, Input<java.lang.Double>, LengthInput<java.lang.Double>, ParseInput<java.lang.Double>, RangedInput<java.lang.Double>, UnitInput

    public class PercentInput
extends DoubleInput
    A DoubleInput which defaults to input a value between 0 and 1 using a percent number format.

    • Method Detail

      • formatRange

        public java.lang.String formatRange(java.lang.Double n)
        Description copied from interface: BoundedInput
        format step/range values as used by the input into compatible to the way they are presented. for example a percent input may use 0.0 and 1.0 but present as 0, 100 used to generate HTML5 ranges.
        Specified by:
        formatRange in interface BoundedInput<java.lang.Double>
        Overrides:
        formatRange in class NumberInput<java.lang.Double>
        Returns:

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Description copied from interface: HTML5Input
        get the type tag to emit for the corresponding html5 type. If this method returns null no type should be used. This is for the case where. a sub-class breaks compatibility and needs to supress a type set in a superclass.
        Specified by:
        getType in interface HTML5Input
        Overrides:
        getType in class NumberInput<java.lang.Double>
        Returns:
        name or null;
